subject: Physics

subtopics.title: Energy changes in a system
content: Energy is conserved in any closed system
Energy can be stored in various ways: kinetic, gravitational potential, elastic potential, thermal, chemical, nuclear
Changes in energy stores can be calculated using equations
Power is the rate of energy transfer
Efficiency is the proportion of energy transferred usefully
Energy can be transferred usefully, stored or dissipated
Ways to reduce unwanted energy transfers
required_skills: Calculate kinetic energy using Ek = ½mv²
Calculate gravitational potential energy using Ep = mgh
Calculate power using P = E/t or P = W/t
Calculate efficiency as a decimal or percentage
Describe energy transfers in systems
(HT only) Calculate elastic potential energy using Ee = ½ke²
mathematical_skills: Recall and apply equations for energy calculations
Interpret and draw energy transfer diagrams

required_practicals.name: Specific heat capacity
skills: Use heating method to investigate specific heat capacity

subtopics.title: Conservation and dissipation of energy
content: Energy cannot be created or destroyed
Dissipated energy causes heating of surroundings
Ways to reduce unwanted energy dissipation
Energy resources can be renewable or non-renewable
Advantages and disadvantages of different energy resources
Factors affecting choice of energy resources
required_skills: Calculate energy efficiency
Compare ways of reducing energy dissipation
Evaluate different energy resources
Describe energy transfers in real-world contexts
Calculate payback time for energy-saving measures
mathematical_skills: Use cost-benefit analysis for energy-saving measures

subtopics.title: Current, potential difference and resistance
content: Electric current is flow of charge
required_skills: Draw circuit diagrams using standard symbols
Calculate current, p.d., resistance using V = IR
Explain how resistance varies in different components
Plot and interpret I-V graphs
(HT only) Explain shape of I-V graphs
mathematical_skills: Use and rearrange V = IR equation

required_practicals.name: I-V characteristics
skills: Set up circuits to measure I-V characteristics

subtopics.title: Changes of state and particle model
content: States of matter and particle arrangement
required_skills: Calculate density using ρ = m/V
Explain state changes in terms of particles
Calculate specific latent heat
Explain pressure in terms of particles
(HT only) Explain relationship between pressure and volume

required_practicals.name: Density
skills: Calculate density of regular and irregular objects
Use displacement method for irregular objects

assessment_objectives.AO1: Demonstrate knowledge and understanding of scientific ideas, scientific techniques and procedures
assessment_objectives.AO2: Apply knowledge and understanding of scientific ideas, scientific enquiry, techniques and procedures
assessment_objectives.AO3: Analyse information and ideas to interpret and evaluate, make judgements and draw conclusions, develop and improve experimental procedures

required_apparatus_and_techniques: Use appropriate apparatus to measure and record length, mass, time, temperature, current, potential difference
Use circuit diagrams to construct and check series and parallel circuits
Use appropriate apparatus to measure energy transfers and determine specific heat capacity
Use appropriate apparatus to measure density
Use appropriate apparatus to measure acceleration, velocity, force
equations_to_recall: efficiency = useful output energy transfer ÷ total input energy transfer
gravitational potential energy = mass × gravitational field strength × height
